item.title: Fans hail Fiz Stape’s ’emotional’ Corrie exit - Independent.ie
item.description:
Fans hail Fiz Stape’s ’emotional’ Corrie exit  Independent.ie

Wednesday night’s episode of Coronation Street saw seven-year-old Hope Stape bite six-year-old Ruby Dobbs in an unprovoked attack – triggering the exit of one of the soap’s best-loved characters. Fiz Stape, played by Jennie McAlpine, will leave Weatherfield to take her daughter to a specialist unit in Birmingham. Fans watching at home were left horrified after the troubled child once again became violent towards another infant. This time, however, Hope appeared to have gone too far, leaving her mother unable to deny that her child needed professional help. Fiz had previously refused to send...

item.title: Coronation Street actor Peter Armitage has died at the age of 78 - JOE.ie
item.description:
Coronation Street actor Peter Armitage has died at the age of 78  JOE.ie

The actor had three stints on the show as Kevin Webster's father. Coronation Street actorPeter Armitage has passed away at the age of 78. Armiatage played Kevin Webster's father, David, on Coronation Street for a number of years. His friend and co-star Charlie Lawson, who played Jim McDonald on the show, revealed the news on Twitter on Wednesday afternoon. "Peter was a much respected and much loved member of the Coronation Street family," an ITV spokesperson told the BBC. "Our thoughts are with his family and friends at this sad time." @itvcorrie @simongregson123 Its with great sadness, tha...

item.title: Peter Armitage death: Coronation Street actor who played Bill Webster, dies aged 78 - The Independent
item.description:
Peter Armitage death: Coronation Street actor who played Bill Webster, dies aged 78  The Independent

Peter Armitage, who was best known for playing Bill Webster on Coronation Street, has died aged 78. The actor first debuted as Kevin Webster's father on the long-running ITV series more than 30 years ago. Former co-star Charlie Lawson, who plays Jim McDonald on the programme, announced the news on Twitter. "It's with great sadness, that I've to tell you my great old friend Pete Armitage has died," he wrote. "RIP mate." No cause of death has been revealed. Armitage went into remission from bowel cancer four years ago. Notable deaths in 2018 – in pictures - 65 show all Notable deaths in 2018 ...

item.title: Coronation Street actor Alex Bain has become a dad at the age of 17 - Her.ie
item.description:
Coronation Street actor Alex Bain has become a dad at the age of 17  Her.ie

Coronation Street'sAlex Bain and his girlfriend, Levi Selby, have welcomed their first child together. The Sunreport that the pair welcomed a daughter, who they namedLydia-Rose Bain, on Sunday. The new parents, who sat their GCSEs this year, are said to have beeninundated with well wishes and congratulatory messages over the last few days. A source told the publication that the pair were "over the moon" at their new arrival. They said; They are absolutely over the moon its the greatest gift they could have hoped for this Christmas. The 17-year-old actor and his girlfriend announced their ha...

item.title: Hit drama Bodyguard wins TV Moment Of The Year - Independent.ie
item.description:
Hit drama Bodyguard wins TV Moment Of The Year  Independent.ie

Bodyguard’s nailbiting opening scene has won TV Moment Of The Year – beating The Great British Bake Off. The 20-minute opener featured Richard Madden’s alter-ego David Budd trying to prevent a terrorist attack on a commuter train. Other contenders had included Rahul Mandal’s win on The Great British Bake Off and Jack Fincham’s ex-girlfriend arriving on reality show Love Island. Bake Off Judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith with 2018 winner Rahul Mandal (C4/Love Productions/Mark Bourdil) Bodyguard was voted TV Moment Of The Year in Heat magazine’s Unmissables Awards, decided by a panel of in...

item.title: Did Coronation Street pave way for Andy Farrell and Mick McCarthy? - Irish Examiner
item.description:
Did Coronation Street pave way for Andy Farrell and Mick McCarthy?  Irish Examiner

Welcome Mick McCarthy (again). And welcome Andy Farrell (soon), writes Michael Moynihan. The men who head, or will soon head, the national sides in football, soccer and rugger versions respectively, are both alike and not alike. They’re rugged individuals with considerable reputations in two tough businesses, but one is 43 and the other is 59. One is rugby, one soccer, etc. One thing they have in common is the voice. That north-of-England tone, take-things-as-I-see-them air, where-there’s-muck-there’s-brass inflection, the glottal asperity. Mick McCarthy I know the two men aren’t neighbours...

item.title: Malique Thompson-Dwyer leaves I’m A Celebrity after 16 days - Independent.ie
item.description:
Malique Thompson-Dwyer leaves I’m A Celebrity after 16 days  Independent.ie

Malique Thompson-Dwyer has become the second contestant to leave I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! following a public vote. The Hollyoaks star managed 16 days in the jungle but notably struggled with the lack of food, often complaining that he felt weak. Arriving unannounced in the jungle campsite, hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby called the camp members together before announcing the 20-year-old as the second celebrity out. After hugging his campmates, Thompson-Dwyer joined Willoughby and Donnelly in the studio where he told them: “I’m just glad to be out now because I’m absol...

item.title: Strictly is ending but Dancing with the Stars is back - here's what to expect - Independent.ie
item.description:
Strictly is ending but Dancing with the Stars is back - here's what to expect  Independent.ie

As the mother of all televised dance competitions comes careering to a close, we wonder where the year has gone while keeping in perspective the looming Strictly Come Dancing hole in our lives by focusing on what the Irish spin-off has to offer for 2019 The third series of Dancing with the Stars kicks off on January 6, 2019, and the celebrities confirmed to be on the show are coming thick and fast. On Sunday, radio-turned-TV presenter Mairead Ronan was the first contestant confirmed. Yesterday, another two names were revealed in the form of Winnie McGoogan from Mrs Brown’s Boys (aka actress...

item.title: Doctor Who stars reject claim the show has become too PC - The Telegraph
item.description:
Doctor Who stars reject claim the show has become too PC  The Telegraph

Doctor Who stars have rejected claims that the show has become too PC, with one actor asking whether it is even possible to be 'too' correct. Mandip Gill and Tosin Cole, who play Yaz and Ryan in the show, instead praised the programme in an interview with Radio Times for being an "entertaining reminder" of important issues. Ms Gill said she believed the programme was 'creating conversation' on important issues. "It makes me laugh, because having the words 'too' and 'correct' in the same sentence is really bizarre to me. How can you be too correct about something?," she said. "You do see som...

item.title: Sair Khan ‘smashes’ Sickening Sewer Bushtucker trial on I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Sair Khan ‘smashes’ Sickening Sewer Bushtucker trial on I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

I’m A Celebrity star Sair Khan triumphed over rats, crabs and cane toads in tonight’s Bushtucker trial, winning 10 stars and earning her fellow contestants a luxurious dinner of eels. The Coronation Street actress, 30, climbed through dark, hot pipes containing a selection of unpleasant animals in the Sickening Sewer challenge. Completing the trial in good time, host Declan Donnelly proclaimed that she had “smashed” the challenge. Trial Tease: Tonight's Bushtucker Trial takes place in the murky Sickening Sewer, but how will Sair fare? Sink or swim? 😲 #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/2o1GEKzqIn — ...

item.title: Campers eat flies and camel’s foot in I’m A Celebrity trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
Campers eat flies and camel’s foot in I’m A Celebrity trial  Independent.ie

Sair Khan and Malique Thompson-Dwyer munched flies, a sheep’s penis and a camel’s foot in the latest stomach-churning I’m A Celebrity Bushtucker trial. The pair were chosen by the public to tackle the Dreaded Deliveries challenge. Hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby told the worried stars they would be served up an array of vile jungle takeaways. They would win a star – and therefore a meal for their hungry campmates – for each finished dish. Hollyoaks actor Thompson-Dwyer was first, and had to get through a pizza box of dead mealworms, crickets and cockroaches. Dreaded Deliveries is...

item.title: I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp - The Independent
item.description:
I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp  The Independent

I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here is back, with a new raft of famous faces entering the jungle. Football manager Harry Redknapp, Torchwood star John Barrowman and X Factor favourite Fleur East lead this year’s contestants, with Noel Edmonds joining the intrepid adventurers (for a reported £500,000 payday) as the series' final contestant. James McVey, who found fame as part of boy band The Vamps, also appears on the show, alongside soap stars Sair Khan (Coronation Street), Rita Simons (EastEnders) and Malique Thompson-Dwyer (Hollyoaks). Who else features? You can see all eleven of this y...

item.title: Kym Marsh, 42, to be a grandmother - Independent.ie
item.description:
Kym Marsh, 42, to be a grandmother  Independent.ie

Kym Marsh has revealed she is going to be a grandmother. The Coronation Street actress, 42, said she cannot wait to welcome her 21-year-old daughter Emilie’s first child, having been a young mother herself. Marsh became a mother at the age of 18 with son David, and had Emilie at 21, with ex-partner Dave Cunliffe. She and ex-husband Jamie Lomas also have seven-year-old daughter Polly, who was born two years after their son Archie died due to a premature birth. Marsh told OK! magazine: “I’m looking forward to being a young grandmother.” Kym Marsh’s daughter Emilie is pregnant with her first c...

item.title: Noel Edmonds officially joins I'm a Celebrity - JOE.ie
item.description:
Noel Edmonds officially joins I'm a Celebrity  JOE.ie

Kiosk Kev vs the Banker. Deal Or No Deal host and Mr Blobby accomplice Noel Edmonds will join the rest of the I'm a Celeb hopefuls in the Australian jungle. Followingweeks of feverish speculation, Edmonds confirmed on Wednesday morning he will appear on the reality TV show. "After everything I have done with Gotchas and gunging, I am well aware they are going to put me through absolute hell and I deserve it," Edmonds said. "I think the British public will enjoy seeing me finally getting my comeuppance. I just know they are going to really give me a hard time." The boy Noel Credit: ITV So, w...

item.title: BBC puts period drama and one-off specials on Christmas menu - The Guardian
item.description:
BBC puts period drama and one-off specials on Christmas menu  The Guardian

The BBC has unveiled its Christmas TV schedule, with a focus on period drama and special editions of popular entertainment shows. High-profile series scheduled for the festive period include an adaptation of Agatha Christie’s The ABC Murders starring John Malkovich and Rupert Grint; a six-part take on Victor Hugo’s Les Miserables with Dominic West as Jean Valjean, David Oyelowo and Lily Collins; and a new version of Watership Down featuring the voices of John Boyega, Olivia Colman, Sir Ben Kingsley, Gemma Arterton, Peter Capaldi and Mackenzie Crook. Comedian Lee Mack will take part in a liv...

item.title: Fears for Corrie's Sinead Tinker as latest cancer treatment could bring more heartache - Her.ie
item.description:
Fears for Corrie's Sinead Tinker as latest cancer treatment could bring more heartache  Her.ie

There are fresh fears for Sinead Tinker as her latest cancer treatment could lead to more heartache. The Weatherfielder was diagnosed with cervical cancer earlier this year, soon after finding out that she was pregnant with Daniel Osborne's baby. She has since been lying to him about going to chemotherapy and instead, trying alternative medicine in an effort to cure the illness herself. A chance at a special kind of treatment in Germany brought fresh hopes for Sinead, as she discovered that she might be able to save the life of her unborn child. But Coronation Street actor Katie McGlynn has...

item.title: Soap Spoilers! The MUST see moments this week - RTÉ News
item.description:

Wayne pleads with Dolores to come back to the hospital and reveals his fears that Junior is being bullied. Doctor Alice breaks the news to Wayne that Junior has Fanconi Anaemia. Wayne tells Orla and they are both worried that it will lead to Leukaemia. They are nervous as Junior begins treatment and Wayne reached out to Tommy to help find a bone marrow match for Junior and Tommy says he will do anythin...

item.description:
There's a Pat Phelan storyline coming up on Corrie next week  Her.ie

Yes, you did read that correctly. And no, it isn'y early-to-mid 2018 but you'd be forgiven for thinking that it was. Pat Phelan met his end in June of this year after months upon months of him killing people, doing shady and questionable shit, and essentially never getting caught. At one point he even swam to Ireland, like it was a regular and normal thing for a human being to do. Bizarre. Anyway, everybody in the world was of course delighted when they discovered that Phelan would be no more, his reign of terror was over, and that we'd never have to speak of him again. That was, until, nex...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle  The Independent

After a week of rumours, ITV has officially announced that Noel Edmonds is heading into the I'm A Celebrity jungle. The former host of Deal Or No Deal will join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, The Chase star Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. "Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" read a Tweet from the I'm A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday (20 November). Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle! #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/dGjIsTegT9 — I'm A Celebrity... (@imacelebrity) 21 November 2018 The pos...

item.title: Teen pregnancy bombshell for Corrie as 14-year-old Amy Barlow discovers she's expecting - Her.ie
item.description:
Teen pregnancy bombshell for Corrie as 14-year-old Amy Barlow discovers she's expecting  Her.ie

There'll be a teen pregnancy bombshell for Steve and Tracy in the new year as their daughter Amy announces that she's expecting a baby. The 14-year-old will discover that she's pregnant in a few months, sending her parents into a state of panic as they try to decide what to do. Tracy and Steve will seemingly try to convince Amy to have an abortion, telling her that she's too young to be a mother, but reports suggest that the teenager will decide to continue with the pregnancy. According to Digital Spy, Amy initially agrees to terminate the pregnancy, agreeing that she isn't ready to be a pa...

item.title: One of our FAVE Corrie stars is rumoured to be returning to the cobbles next year - Her.ie
item.description:
One of our FAVE Corrie stars is rumoured to be returning to the cobbles next year  Her.ie

And we're so glad to hear it. One of the most loved Coronation Street characters is said to be returning to the show next year. Yes, Norris Cole (played by Malcolm Hebden) is reportedly making his big return to the cobbles next year after nearly a year away. Actor Malcolm Hebden suffered a heart attack last year which resulted in him being placed in an induced coma for three weeks. However, according to reports, Malcolm's recovery is going well and he spoke with showrunners recently about how he and his character would return to the show. I was so pleasantly surprised to see him, a cast mem...

item.title: Noel Edmonds officially announced as I'm A Celebrity contestant - The Telegraph
item.description:
Noel Edmonds officially announced as I'm A Celebrity contestant  The Telegraph

Noel Edmonds has officially been announced as an I'm A Celebrity contestant. The 69-year-old former host of Deal Or No Deal and Noel's House Party will enter the Australian jungle to join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, quiz expert Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. Edmonds's arrival had been rumoured and was confirmed by the official I'm A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday. The tweet said: "Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" The post, which described Edmonds as a "TV legend", listed his phobias as heights and confined spaces...

item.title: Corrie's David Platt horrified after getting an unexpected visit from someone in his past - Her.ie
item.description:
Corrie's David Platt horrified after getting an unexpected visit from someone in his past  Her.ie

He's going to be "confused and horrified". Coronation Street'sDavid Platt is reportedly going to be in for a massive shock as someone from his past arrives in Weatherfield. According toThe Sun,David's former cellmate, Paul Foreman, is going to be making a dramatic arrival on the cobbles soon enough. The pair haven't seen - or spoken - to each other in more than six months, and the hairdresser "isn't going to know what to do" when he sees his former prison pal. A source told the publication: "David isn't going to know what to do when he sees Paul on the cobbles.He and Paul got on well in pri...
